00022 #ifdef _WIN32
00023 #pragma once
00024 #endif
00025 #include <FdoStd.h>
00026 #include <fdo/Schema/ClassDefinition.h>
00027 #include <fdo/Raster/IRaster.h>
00028 #include <fdo/Expression/LOBValue.h>
00029 
00030 /// \brief
00031 /// The FdoIFeatureReader interface provides a forward-only, read-only iterator
00032 /// for reading feature data.  A reference to an FdoIFeatureReader is returned
00033 /// from the Select and SelectAndLock commands. Because the initial position of the
00034 /// FdoIFeatureReader is prior to the first item, you must call
00035 /// ReadNext to begin accessing any data.
00036 class FdoIReader: public GisIDisposable
00037 {
00038 public:
00039     /// \brief
00040     /// Gets the Boolean value of the specified property. No conversion is
00041     /// performed, thus the property must be FdoDataType_Boolean or an 
00042     /// exception is thrown.
00043     /// 
00044     /// \param propertyName 
00045     /// Input the property name.
00046     /// 
00047     /// \return
00048     /// Returns the Boolean value.
00049     /// 
00050     FDO_API virtual bool GetBoolean(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00051 
00052     /// \brief
00053     /// Gets the byte value of the specified property. No conversion is 
00054     /// performed, thus the property must be FdoDataType_Byte or an 
00055     /// exception is thrown.
00056     /// 
00057     /// \param propertyName 
00058     /// Input the property name.
00059     /// 
00060     /// \return
00061     /// Returns the byte value.
00062     /// 
00063     FDO_API virtual GisByte GetByte(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00064 
00065     /// \brief
00066     ///  Gets the date and time value of the specified property. No conversion is 
00067     /// performed, thus the property must be FdoDataType_DateTime or an 
00068     /// exception is thrown.
00069     /// 
00070     /// \param propertyName 
00071     /// Input the property name.
00072     /// 
00073     /// \return
00074     /// Returns the date and time value.
00075     /// 
00076     FDO_API virtual GisDateTime GetDateTime(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00077 
00078     /// \brief
00079     /// Gets the double-precision floating point value of the specified property. No
00080     /// conversion is performed, thus the property must be FdoDataType_Double
00081     /// or an exception is thrown.
00082     /// 
00083     /// \param propertyName 
00084     /// Input the property name.
00085     /// 
00086     /// \return
00087     /// Returns the double floating point value
00088     /// 
00089     FDO_API virtual double GetDouble(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00090 
00091     /// \brief
00092     /// Gets the 16-bit integer value of the specified property. No conversion is
00093     /// performed, thus the property must be FdoDataType_Int16 or an exception
00094     /// is thrown.
00095     /// 
00096     /// \param propertyName 
00097     /// Input the property name.
00098     /// 
00099     /// \return
00100     /// Returns the GisInt16 value.
00101     /// 
00102     FDO_API virtual GisInt16 GetInt16(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00103 
00104     /// \brief
00105     /// Gets the 32-bit integer value of the specified property. No conversion is
00106     /// performed, thus the property must be FdoDataType_Int32 or an exception
00107     /// is thrown.
00108     /// 
00109     /// \param propertyName 
00110     /// Input the property name.
00111     /// 
00112     /// \return
00113     /// Returns the GisInt32 value
00114     /// 
00115     FDO_API virtual GisInt32 GetInt32(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00116 
00117     /// \brief
00118     /// Gets the 64-bit integer value of the specified property. No conversion is
00119     /// performed, thus the property must be FdoDataType_Int64 or an exception
00120     /// is thrown.
00121     /// 
00122     /// \param propertyName 
00123     /// Input the property name.
00124     /// 
00125     /// \return
00126     /// Returns the GisInt64 value.
00127     /// 
00128     FDO_API virtual GisInt64 GetInt64(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00129 
00130     /// \brief
00131     /// Gets the Single floating point value of the specified property. No
00132     /// conversion is performed, thus the property must be FdoDataType_Single
00133     /// or an exception is thrown.
00134     /// 
00135     /// \param propertyName 
00136     /// Input the property name.
00137     /// 
00138     /// \return
00139     /// Returns the single value
00140     /// 
00141     FDO_API virtual float GetSingle(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00142 
00143     /// \brief
00144     /// Gets the string value of the specified property. No conversion is
00145     /// performed, thus the property must be FdoDataType_String or an exception
00146     /// is thrown.
00147     /// 
00148     /// \param propertyName 
00149     /// Input the property name.
00150     /// 
00151     /// \return
00152     /// Returns the string value
00153     /// 
00154     FDO_API virtual GisString* GetString(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00155 
00156     /// \brief
00157     /// Gets a LOBValue reference. The LOB is fully read in and data available.
00158     /// Because no conversion is performed, the property must be FdoDataType_BLOB or
00159     /// FdoDataType_CLOB etc. (a LOB type)
00160     /// 
00161     /// \param propertyName 
00162     /// Input the property name.
00163     /// 
00164     /// \return
00165     /// Returns the reference to LOBValue
00166     /// 
00167     FDO_API virtual FdoLOBValue* GetLOB(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00168 
00169     /// \brief
00170     /// Gets a reference of the specified LOB property as a FdoBLOBStreamReader or
00171     /// FdoCLOBStreamReader etc. to allow reading in blocks of data.
00172     /// Because no conversion is performed, the property must be FdoDataType_BLOB 
00173     /// or FdoDataType_CLOB etc. (a LOB type)
00174     /// Cast the GisIStreamReader to the appropiate LOB Stream Reader.
00175     /// 
00176     /// \param propertyName 
00177     /// Input the property name.
00178     /// 
00179     /// \return
00180     /// Returns a reference to a LOB stream reader
00181     /// 
00182     FDO_API virtual GisIStreamReader* GetLOBStreamReader(const wchar_t* propertyName ) = 0;
00183 
00184     /// \brief
00185     /// Returns true if the value of the specified property is null.
00186     /// 
00187     /// \param propertyName 
00188     /// Input the property name.
00189     /// 
00190     /// \return
00191     /// Returns true if the value is null.
00192     /// 
00193     FDO_API virtual bool IsNull(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00194 
00195     
00196 
00197     /// \brief
00198     /// Gets the geometry value of the specified property as a byte array in 
00199     /// AGF format. Because no conversion is performed, the property must be
00200     /// of Geometric type; otherwise, an exception is thrown.
00201     /// 
00202     /// \param propertyName 
00203     /// Input the property name.
00204     /// 
00205     /// \return
00206     /// Returns the byte array in AGF format.
00207     /// 
00208     FDO_API virtual GisByteArray* GetGeometry(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00209 
00210 
00211     /// \brief
00212     /// Gets the raster object of the specified property.
00213     /// Because no conversion is performed, the property must be
00214     /// of Raster type; otherwise, an exception is thrown.
00215     /// 
00216     /// \param propertyName 
00217     /// Input the property name.
00218     /// 
00219     /// \return
00220     /// Returns the raster object.
00221     /// 
00222     FDO_API virtual FdoIRaster* GetRaster(GisString* propertyName) = 0;
00223 
00224     /// \brief
00225     /// Advances the reader to the next item and returns true if there is
00226     /// another object to read or false if reading is complete. The default
00227     /// position of the reader is prior to the first item. Thus you must
00228     /// call ReadNext to begin accessing any data.
00229     /// 
00230     /// \return
00231     /// Returns true if there is a next item.
00232     /// 
00233     FDO_API virtual bool ReadNext() = 0;
00234 
00235     /// \brief
00236     /// Closes the FdoIFeatureReader object, freeing any resources it may be holding.
00237     /// 
00238     /// \return
00239     /// Returns nothing
00240     /// 
00241     FDO_API virtual void Close() = 0;
00242 };
00243 #endif
